lines.text: I hate the way you talk to me, and the way you cut your hair. I hate the way you drive my car. I hate it when you stare. I hate your big dumb combat boots, and the way you read my mind. I hate you so much it makes me sick; it even makes me rhyme. I hate it, I hate the way you're always right. I hate it when you lie. I hate it when you make me laugh, even worse when you make me cry. I hate it when you're not around, and the fact that you didn't call. But mostly I hate the way I don't hate you. Not even close, not even a little bit, not even at all.
Hello, Katarina. Make anyone cry today?
It's not everyday you find a girl who'll flash someone to get you out of detention.
Some asshole paid me to take out this really great girl.
Is that right?
Yeah, but I screwed up. I, um, I fell for her.
Just 'cause you're beautiful, that doesn't mean that you can treat people like they don't matter.
I guess in this society, being male and an asshole makes you worthy of our time.
She never wanted me. She wanted Joey the whole time.
Cameron, do you like the girl?
Yeah.
Yeah, and is she worth all this trouble?
Well, I thought she was, but you know, I...
Well, she is or she isn't. See first of all, Joey is not half the man you are. Secondly, don't let anyone ever make you feel like you don't deserve what you want. Go for it.
So what's your excuse?
For?
Acting the way we do.
I don't like to do what people expect.Why should I live up to other people's expectations instead of my own?
So you disappoint them from the start and then you're covered, right?
Something like that
Then you screwed up!
How?
You never disappointed me.
Mr. Morgan, is there any chance we could get Kat to take her Midol *before* she comes to class?
Someday, you gonna get bitch-slapped and I'm not gonna do a thing to stop it.
We're going now.
Alright, wait a minute. No drinking, no drugs, no kissing, no tattoos, no piercings, *no* ritual animal slaughters of any kind. Oh, God, I'm giving them ideas.

[Bianca and Chastity are sneaking past Bianca's father]
Shoulda used the window!
Hi Daddy!
Hi... where're we going?
Well, if you must know... a small study group of friends.
Otherwise known as an orgy?
Mr. Stratford, it's just a party!
And hell is just a sauna.
[last lines]
You can't just buy me a guitar every time you screw up, you know?
Yeah, I know. But then, you know, there's always drums, and bass, and maybe even one day a tambourine.
Tell me something true.
Something true... I hate peas.
No, something real, something no one else knows.
Okay, you're sweet, and sexy, and completely hot for me.
[after Joey punches Cameron, Bianca punches Joey in the face]
Shit, Bianca, I'm shooting a nose spray ad tomorrow!
That's for making my date bleed!
[punches him again]
That's for my sister!
[knees him in the crotch]
And that's for me!
Someone still has her panties in a twist.
Don't, for one minute, think that you had any effect whatsoever on my panties.
Then what did I have an effect on?
Other than my upchuck reflex, nothing.
What is it with this chick? She have beer-flavored nipples?
You're not surrounded by your usual cloud of smoke.
I know, I quit. Apparently they're bad for you.
You think?
Where's your sister going?
She's meeting some bikers. Big ones. Full of sperm.
Funny.
This morning, I delivered a set of twins to a fifteen-year-old girl, do you know what she said to me?
"I'm a crack-whore who should have made my skeazy boyfriend wear a condom"?
Close, but no. She said, "I should have listened to my father".
She did not.
Well, that's what she would have said if she wasn't so doped up!
[after purposefully crashing into a car]
Whoops.

[after reading Shakespearean sonnet]
Now, I know Shakespeare's a dead white guy, but he knows his shit, so we can overlook that. I want you all to write your own version of this sonnet.
[Kat raises her hand in the background]
Yes, Miss "I Have An Opinion About Everything"?
Well maybe you're not afraid of me but I'm sure you've thought about me naked, huh?

[sarcastically]
Am I that transparent? I want you, I *need* you, oh baby, oh baby.
Ooh, see that, there. Who needs affection when I have blind hatred?

[drunk. Leans in close to Patrick]
Hey... your eyes have a little green in them.
[Patrick smiles momentarily, then Kat vomits at his feet]
The shit hath hitith the fan... ith.
Was that a yes?
No.
Well, then, was that a no?
No.
All right, not that I give a damn, but how was everybody's weekend?
Oh, I dunno, maybe we should ask Kat?
Unless she kicked the crap outta your dumb butt, I don't wanna hear about it!

You know fathers don't like to admit it when their daughters are capable of running their own lives. It means we've become spectators. Bianca still let's me play a few innings - you've had me on the bench for years. When you go to Sarah Lawrence, I won't even be able to watch the game.
*When* I go?
Oh, boy. Don't tell me you changed your mind. I already sent 'em a check.
[Kat gasps in surprise, then hugs her father]
So, I hear you were terrorizing Mr. Morgan's class... again.
Expressing my opinion is not a terrorist action.
The way you expressed your opinion to Bobby Ridgeway? By the way, his testicle retrieval operation went quite well, in case you're interested.
I still maintain that he kicked himself in the balls.
Romantic? Hemingway? He was an abusive, alcoholic misogynist who squandered half of his life hanging around Picasso trying to nail his leftovers.

I know how difficult it must be for you to overcome all those years of upper middle-class suburban oppression. Must be tough. But the next time you storm the PTA crusading for better... lunch meat, or whatever it is you white girls complain about, ask them WHY they can't buy a book written by a black man!
That's right mon!
Don't even get me started on you two!
[Mumble to themselves]
You look pretty nervous.
Yes, sir.
You're sweating like a pig.
Yes, sir.
You're eyes are all... bloodshot.
Yes, sir.
You've got pot, don't you?
[the kid pulls out a bag]
I'm confiscating this.
[walks away and sees Cheetos on another students desk]
This too.
[Mr. Stratford makes Bianca wear a pregnancy belly before leaving for a party, Patrick arrives and sees her]

[to Kat]
Who knocked up your sister?
Wow, is this what a bar looks like?
[reaches into a jar]
Don't touch anything! You may get hepatitis.
[they find Patrick drinking and smoking]
So what have ya got for me?
A little insight into a very complicated girl.
Excuse me, uh, just one question before we start. Should you be drinking alcohol when you don't have a liver?

[confused]
What?
Nothing. Nothing.
Alright, uh, first thing, Kat hates smokers.
[slowly removes Patrick's cigarette]
So, you're telling me I'm a... non-smoker.
Yes. Well, just for now.
And, um, and here's another problem. Bianca said that Kat likes pretty guys.

[looks confused and slowly rises]
Are you telling me I'm not a pretty guy?
H-He's very pretty. He's a gorgeous guy.
Yeah. I-I just wasn't sure. I didn't know.

[gives him two thumbs up]
You're a gorgeous guy.
Thai food, feminist pros and angry girl music of the Indie Rock persuasion. Here's a list of the CDs that she has in her room.
So, I'm supposed to buy her some noodles and a book and sit around listening to chicks who can't play their instruments, right?
Have you ever been to Club Skunk?
Her favorite band's playing there tomorrow night.
I can't be seen at Club Skunk. All right?
But she'll be there, she's got tickets.
Hey listen, assail your ears for one night.
She has a pair of black underwear, if that helps.

[laughing cooly]
Couldn't hurt, right?
[when asked if he'll date Katarina]
Maybe if we were the last two people alive, and there were no sheep. Are there sheep?
Patrick Verona. I see we're making our visits a weekly ritual.
Only so we can have these moments together. Should I, uh, hit the lights?
Oh, very clever, kangaroo boy. Says here you exposed yourself in the cafeteria?
I was joking with the lunch lady. It was a bratwurst.
Bratwurst? Aren't we the optimist? Next time, keep it in your pouch, okay? Scoot!
We are screwed.
Hey, no, hey. I don't wanna hear that defeatist attitude... I wanna hear you upbeat!

[more upbeat]
We are screwed!
There ya go.
I'm down, I've got the 411, and you are not going out and getting jiggy with some boy, I don't care how dope his ride is. My momma didn't raise no foo'!
But she's a mutant! What if she never dates?
Then you'll never date. Oh, I like that.
Alright. Uh, I talked to her; I got the scoop.
What'd she say?
"Hates him with the fire of a thousand suns." That's a direct quote.
Thanks Michael. That's very comforting of you.
Well, you don't know. She could, uh, she could need a day to cool off.
[they all duck as a soccer ball flies past them]
Maybe two.
Hey there girly. How you doin'?
Sweating like a pig actually and yourself?
Now there's a way to get a guy's attention huh?
My mission in life. But, obviously I struck your fancy so you see it worked. The world makes sense again.
People perceive you as somewhat...
Tempestuous?
"Heinous bitch" is the term used most often.
You are amazingly self-assured, has anyone ever told you that?
I tell myself that every day, actually.
[both speaking french]
May I offer you a parsnip?
No, you may not.
Where is my uncle's pencil?
I don't know. Maybe it is up your ass?
Sweet love, renew thy force.
[Start of Shakespeare's Sonnet LVI]
Hey! Don't say shit like that to me. People can hear you.
Leave it to you to use big words when you're smashed.
And I'm BACK IN THE GAME!
You're gunna pay me to take out some chick?
Mmhm.
How much?
20 bucks.
...fine 30.
Well, let's think about this... we go to the movies, that's 15 bucks. We get popcorn, that's 53. And she'll want raisonettes, alright? So, we're looking at 75 bucks.
This isn't a negotiation. Take it or leave it trailer park.
50 bucks and we got a deal, Fabio.
I know you can be overwhelmed, and you can be underwhelmed, but can you ever just be whelmed?
I think you can in Europe.
I learned French for you!
What is it, Asshole Day?
Do you know what happens at proms?
Yes. We'll dance, we'll kiss, we'll come home. It's not quite the crisis situation you imagine.
Kissing? That's what you think happens? I've got news for you. Kissing isn't what keeps me up to my elbows in placenta all day long.
Can we, for two seconds, ignore the fact that you're severely unhinged and discuss my need for a night of teenage normalcy?
What's normal? Those damn... Dawson's river kids sleeping in each other's beds and what not?
Daddy that is so not...
I've got news for you. I'm down, I've got the 411, and you are not going out and getting jiggy with some boy, I don't care how dope his ride is. Mamma didn't raise no fool.
Nine schools in ten years. My, my. Army brat?
Yeah, my-my dad is, uh...
That's enough. I'm sure you won't find Padua any different than your old schools. Same little asswipe shit-for-brains everywhere.
Excuse me? D-Did you just say... Am I in the right office?
Not any more you're not. I've got deviants to see and a novel to finish. Now scoot. Scoot!

[about Bianca]
What's there is a snotty little princess wearing a strategically planned sundress to make guys like us realize we can never touch her, and guys like, uh, Joey realize they want to. She, my friend, is what we will spend the rest of our lives not having, Put her in your "Spank Bank" and move on.
No, no, no! You're wrong about her. I mean, you know, not about the spanking, but the rest, you're wrong!
See, first of all, Joey is not half the man you are. Secondly, don't let anyone, ever, make you feel like you don't deserve what you want. Go for it!
My insurance does not cover PMS!
Well then, tell them I had a seizure.
[talking about the prom]
Can you even imagine? Who the hell would go to that antiquated mating-ritual?
I would, but I don't have a date.
Do you really wanna get all dressed up, so some Drakkar Noir-wearing dexter with a boner can feel you up while you're forced to listen to a band that, by definition, blows?
You're asking me out? That's so cute! What's your name again?
You don't buy black lingerie unless you want someone to see it.

[holding up headshots]
Which one do you like better?
Umm, I think I like the white shirt better.
Yeah, it's-it's more...
Pensive?
Damn, I was going for thoughtful.
Get outta my class.
What?
Out. Get out!
Thanks, Mr. Morgan.
Shut up!

[while trying to get Kat go out with him]
Well, the night I take you places you've never been before.
Like where, the 7-11 on Broadway?
There's a difference between like and love. Because, I like my Skechers, but I love my Prada backpack.
But I love my Skechers.
That's because you don't have a Prada backpack.
I thought you wanted out.
Yeah, well, I did, but, uh... that was until she kissed me.
Where?
In the car.
joey never told you that we went out did he?
yeah ok...
[disbelieving]
in ninth, for a month
why?

[sarcastically]
because he was like... such a babe
I burn, I pine, I perish.
[Lucentio's line from The Taming of the Shrew Act I Scene 1]
Of course you do. You know, she's beautiful and deep, I'm sure.
Not a big talker, huh?
Depends on the topic. My fenders don't really whip me into a verbal frenzy.
People expect me to be there!
Kat's not going, you're not going!
Why can't you be normal?
Define normal.
Bogey Lowenstein's party is normal.
What's a Bogey Lowenstein?
Bogey's party is just a lame excuse for all the idiots at our school to drink beer and rub up against each other in hopes of distracting themselves from the pathetic emptiness of their meaningless...
...meaningless, consumer-driven lives.
You're 18, you don't know what you want. And you won't know what you want 'til you're 45, and even if you get it, you'll be too old to use it.
Can't you just find some blind, deaf retard to take you to the movies so I can have one date?
I'm sorry. Looks like you'll just have to miss out on the witty repartee of Joey "eat me" Donner.
And I'll get to sleep at night. The deep slumber of a father whose daughters aren't out being impregnated.
And I didn't sleep with a Spice Girl... I think.
Remove head from sphincter, then drive!

[after Kat has told her that she went out with Joey]
How is it possible that I did not know about this?
I warned him that if he told anyone, the cheerleading squad would find out how tiny his dick is!

[writing her novel]
Undulating with desire, Adrian removes her red...
[breaks concentration, chooses another word]
crimson cape, at the site of Reginal's stiff and... Judith! What's another word for "engorged"?

[disgusted]
I'll look it up.
Okay.
[thinking of word]
Swollen... Turgid...

[enters]
Tumescent?
Perfect!
[Two guys are fighting in his house, making a mess]
You guys, please! Take it outside!
[They smash through a window]
Thank you!
I thought for sure I was busted when I was climbing out that window, I tell you. So, how did you keep him distracted?
I dazzled him with my... wits.
Have you seen him?
Who?
William. He asked me to meet him here.
Oh Mandella, please tell me you haven't progressed to full-on hallucinations.

[the doorbell rings]
That must be Nigel with the brie.

[talking to Mr. Chapin in detention]
Well, now that you've seen "the plan", I'm gonna go and show "the plan" to someone else.

[to Patrick - after he asks her out for the first time]
Do you even know my name screwboy?
No dating till you graduate.
Where did you come from? Planet "Loser"?
As opposed to Planet "Look At Me, Look At Me"?
You embarrassed the girl. Sacrifice yourself on the altar of dignity and even the score.
These delusionals are your White Rastas. Uh, they're big Marley fans, they think they're black, semi-political, but mostly...
Smoke a lot of weed?
Has the fact that you're completely psycho managed to escape your attention?

[to Patrick after Kat backs into his car when he won't move it out her way]
Watching that bitch violate my car doesn't count as a date.
Your sister here?
Stay away from my sister.
Oh, I'll stay away from your sister, but I can't guarantee she'll stay away from me.
I'll let you get back to Reginald's quivering member.
"Quivering member." I like that.
You're looking at this from entirely the wrong perspective. We're making a statement.
Oh goody, something new and different for us!
I'm thinking of getting a Tercel. Yeah, that's a Toyota.
I was watching you out there, before. I've never seen you look so sexy.
[Patrick is refusing to help Cameron go out with Bianca]
Joey can plough whatever he wants.

[angrily]
Hey! There will be no ploughing!
Have you seen the unwashed miscreants that go to that school?
You don't always have to be who they want you to be, you know?
I happen to like being adored, thank you!
I have a dick on my face, don't I?
Oh wait... was that... did your hairline just recede?
You're not as vile as I thought you were.
Are you lost?
No, actually I just came by to chat.
We don't chat.
You suck!

[Mocking Bianca]
You suck!
I know who you wanna bend the rules for. It's that hot-rod Joey.
What's a hot-rod?
What is it with this chick, she have beer flavored nipples?
Hey!
Can we for two seconds ignore the fact that you're severely unhinged and discuss my need for a night of teenage normalcy?
What's normal? Those damn Dawson's River kids, sleeping in each other's beds and whatnot?
